text: Hi guys! I have a question about the crm.objects.contacts.write scope, specifically in relation to contact deletion permissions. We have developed an app that does not require permissions to delete contacts at a practical level, but does need permissions to modify the content of certain CRM contact properties. The admin user of our client does not want their HubSpot users to have permissions to delete contacts, which is part of the scope of the app due to crm.objects.contacts.write. However, the app does not delete contacts or need to do so. Is there a workaround for this, or do we need a different scope?
Hello, one of you can light the path on how to integrate 3cx with HubSpot ?
If the app doesn't delete, then your client should be fine as you would never call that endpoint of the API.

Thanks, <@U03REFNRMB3>. Their main concern is that app users on the client's end don't have this permission on (delete contacts). Therefore, they can't install the app because the app requires this permission. What's the best way to handle this?=
You need to use the optional scope.
Then in the APP itself, you can check the oauth and the scope allowed to do the crm property updates when needed.
otherwise, you would need an Admin to install the App.
To use optional_scoping you need to enable advanced scope settings in the App.
That could be. So, in this case, the app writes info to a CRM contact property, but doesn't delete contact. Would the optional_scoping setting still be the best option?

That would be one of the biggest HubSpot limitations, no attachments, only links. This is supposed to promote link tracking. There are several requests for features but they are years old so I wouldn't hold my breath :sweat_smile: You could try setting up external service for sending emails and send files via API with HubSpot bcc but this will only log the emails and you will have to resolve can-spam or similar depending on your location.
